issue.title: [C++][Python] Fix the unit tests for the ORC reader
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-11199](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11199). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
This issue is a follow-up of ARROW-1968. Now that the ORC writer has been written we should fix the ORC reader tests.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11199?focusedCommentId=17283459) by Ian Alexander Joiner (yingzhou474):*
I have eliminated all old ORC tests in Python that depend on reading from some ORC or other file in the repo. Once we add the ORC writer to C/Glib & Ruby we will clear these files from the repo altogether.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11199?focusedCommentId=17325716) by Ian Alexander Joiner (yingzhou474):*
Per `[~apitrou]`   a reader test with a manual ORC writing process does serve its purpose. There is no need to remove it.
